critique: This executive order aims to increase federal contracting opportunities for service-disabled veteran businesses. It directs agency heads and administrators to implement policies and programs to achieve this goal. There is no direct indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, executive power expansion, federalism shift, national security vs. civil liberties conflict, economic regulation, or social inclusion/conformity issues. The order seems to be a targeted effort to support veteran-owned businesses within the existing framework of federal contracting. Therefore, most scores should be neutral.
